frameDefinitions: In this frame an Emission emanates from a Source along a Path or to a Goal.
An Agent causes a Patient to be affected, sometimes by a particular Means or by use of an Instrument.
An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.
A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1)
A Material is used to make a Product.
frameExamples: A professional dishwasher doesn't <t>do</t> dishes with a rag anymore!
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
These cooking <t><fex name='mat'>ingredients</fex></t> are readily available.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source</fen> .
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location from which the <fen>Emission</fen> emanates.
This role identifies the time when the emanation occurs.
This role identifies the act that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional act that affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
Patient is the entity acted on and that may, but need not, undergo a change.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
The <fen>Agent</fen>'s breathing causes the motion of the <fen>Air</fen>.  <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument.
<fen>Air</fen> is the substance that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to move.
The time at which breathing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the breathing occurs.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a created entity.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
The entity which is used to make a <fen>Product</fen>.
The purpose for which the <fen>Material</fen> is intended.
The entity or substance that is created out of the <fen>Material</fen>.
listRoleExamples: A professional dishwasher does <fex>dishes</fex> one at a time.
All I know is that he was still breathing <fex>at 2AM</fex>.
Lee breathed with difficulty <fex>on the track</fex>.
Add all the <fex>ingredients</fex>, toss and chill.
Supply and placing of <fex>building</fex> materials shall be incidental to installation of the paving stones.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Sustainable Bonuses: Sign of Corporate Responsibility or Window Dressing
"Sustainable Bonuses: Sign of Corporate Responsibility or Window Dressing?
